subject: p12736592
History: -year-old male with right chest tube for hemothorax.
Findings: Single portable view of the chest is compared to previous exam from earlier the same day at 4:57 pm. There has been interval placement of a right-sided chest tube. Left-sided chest tube is again seen with some persistent left basilar pneumothorax. Cardiomediastinal silhouette is stable as are the osseous and soft tissue structures which are better characterized by CT scan.
